learning_objective: Model how computer hardware and software work together as a system to accomplish tasks.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex has discovered a game app that meticulously simulates soccer play-by-play. As they use the app and interact with it, which part of the device is acting like a referee, ensuring that all parts of the system collaborate well to deliver the soccer simulation to Alex?",
    "Answer1": "The game app",
    "Answer2": "The touch screen",
    "Answer3": "The operating system",
    "Answer4": "The battery",
    "CorrectAnswer": "3",
    "Explanation": "The operating system plays the central role in interoperability, coordinating complex interactions involving the device's hardware and software. Much like a soccer referee, it ensures that all parts of the system are working in harmony, responding to the user's actions and delivering the required results.",
    "code_snippet": "class SoccerApp
    action Main
        speak("Welcome to the Soccer game app!")
        number plays = 0
        while plays < 90
            speak("Enter your commands")
            text inputs = input()
            MovePlayer(inputs)
            plays = plays + 1
        end
        speak("The game is over!")
    end

    action MovePlayer(text inputs)
        // Simulation of player movement based on user commands
    end
end"
}
